headline: Where Robotics Is Headed: RealSense Identifies the 5 Trends Defining Robotics in 2026
summary: LAS VEGAS, January 05, 2026--CES 2026 —As robots move from novelty to necessity across factories, warehouses, hospitals, and public spaces, CES 2026 is making one thing clear: visual perception will define the future of robotics.

headline: Gold, Dollar Rise on Venezuela as AI Fuels Stocks: Markets Wrap
summary: Spot gold advanced nearly 2% to climb above $4,410 an ounce, while silver jumped more than 3%.  Nasdaq 100 futures were up 0.7%, with chip stocks such as Micron Technology Inc. and Intel Corp. gaining more than 3% in premarket trading.  Chevron Corp. rose more than 7% in early trading, alongside sharp gains across US oil majors, after President Donald Trump floated plans for a US-led revival of Venezuela’s industry.

content.title: Gold, Dollar Rise on Venezuela as AI Fuels Stocks: Markets Wrap
content.summary: Spot gold advanced nearly 2% to climb above $4,410 an ounce, while silver jumped more than 3%.  Nasdaq 100 futures were up 0.7%, with chip stocks such as Micron Technology Inc. and Intel Corp. gaining more than 3% in premarket trading.  Chevron Corp. rose more than 7% in early trading, alongside sharp gains across US oil majors, after President Donald Trump floated plans for a US-led revival of Venezuela’s industry.

headline: Stocks Set to Open Higher as Investors Stay Calm Despite Venezuela Tumult, U.S. Jobs Data Awaited
summary: March S&P 500 E-Mini futures (ESH26) are up +0.27%, and March Nasdaq 100 E-Mini futures (NQH26) are up +0.64% this morning, pointing to a higher open on Wall Street despite fresh geopolitical tensions following the U.S. military operation that captured Venezuelan President Nicolas Maduro.

headline: What Catalysts Are Quietly Shifting The Intel (INTC) Narrative Now
summary: Intel’s fair value estimate has inched up from about US$37.27 to about US$38.14 per share, with a slightly higher discount rate of about 11.53% now applied to a modestly improved revenue growth outlook of about 5.60%. This reflects research that reads as cautiously optimistic, with cleaner recent quarters, better demand signals, and early foundry progress prompting analysts to lift their models while still openly flagging execution risks and an uncertain recovery path. Stay tuned as we unpack...

content.title: What Catalysts Are Quietly Shifting The Intel (INTC) Narrative Now
content.summary: Intel’s fair value estimate has inched up from about US$37.27 to about US$38.14 per share, with a slightly higher discount rate of about 11.53% now applied to a modestly improved revenue growth outlook of about 5.60%. This reflects research that reads as cautiously optimistic, with cleaner recent quarters, better demand signals, and early foundry progress prompting analysts to lift their models while still openly flagging execution risks and an uncertain recovery path. Stay tuned as we unpack...

headline: TSMC Stock Rises As Chips Kick Off 2026 With Rally
summary: TSMC stock leads chip rally as shares of semiconductor companies are off to a strong start in 2026 with the AI megatrend still in the spotlight. headline: TSMC Shares Jump Most Since April After Goldman Lifts Target
summary: Shares of the key supplier to Nvidia Corp. and Apple Inc. jumped as much as 6.9% to touch a new record high in Taipei.  Tech stocks across Asia and the US also gained, including Samsung Electronics Co., Intel Corp., Arm Holdings Plc and CoreWeave Inc.

headline: Marvell and Intel Stocks Are AI Buys, Says Analyst
summary: The AI trade faces doubts about whether it can last another year, but artificial intelligence also has its share of believers on Wall Street.  One is Ben Reitzes, an analyst at Melius Research, who upgraded  Marvell Technology  and  Intel  to Buy from Hold and assigning price targets to both stocks.  Marvell  came in at $135, and Intel at $50.

content.title: Marvell and Intel Stocks Are AI Buys, Says Analyst
content.summary: The AI trade faces doubts about whether it can last another year, but artificial intelligence also has its share of believers on Wall Street.  One is Ben Reitzes, an analyst at Melius Research, who upgraded  Marvell Technology  and  Intel  to Buy from Hold and assigning price targets to both stocks.  Marvell  came in at $135, and Intel at $50.

headline: Intel expected to launch next-gen PC chip at CES in Las Vegas
summary: Intel is set to launch Panther Lake, its new AI chip for laptops, on Monday at ​the CES trade show in Las Vegas, as the company seeks ‌to reassure investors about the first product made using its next-generation manufacturing process called 18A.  Jim Johnson, ‌senior vice president and general manager of Intel's PC group, is expected to give details about the chip in a presentation starting at 6 p.m. EST (2300 GMT).  Intel's prior-generation ‌Lunar Lake chips were largely made by TSMC.

content.title: Intel expected to launch next-gen PC chip at CES in Las Vegas
content.summary: Intel is set to launch Panther Lake, its new AI chip for laptops, on Monday at ​the CES trade show in Las Vegas, as the company seeks ‌to reassure investors about the first product made using its next-generation manufacturing process called 18A.  Jim Johnson, ‌senior vice president and general manager of Intel's PC group, is expected to give details about the chip in a presentation starting at 6 p.m. EST (2300 GMT).  Intel's prior-generation ‌Lunar Lake chips were largely made by TSMC.

summary: Acer announced a comprehensive new range of Veriton desktop computers for businesses, including all-in-ones (AIO), a large tower, and an AImini workstation, designed to boost productivity and creativity amid increasing business demands.

headline: Advantech Partners with Intel® Core™ Ultra Series 3 Processors to Power the Next Wave of Scalable Edge AI Innovation
summary: Advantech (TWSE: 2395), a global leader in Industrial AIoT, announced today the integration of Intel® Core™ Ultra Series 3 processors, built on Intel 18A, into its upcoming portfolio of industrial-grade motherboards and Edge AI computers. This strategic milestone strengthens the long-standing collaboration between Advantech and Intel, delivering breakthrough AI performance and enabling a new generation of intelligent, high-efficiency edge solutions.

content.title: Advantech Partners with Intel® Core™ Ultra Series 3 Processors to Power the Next Wave of Scalable Edge AI Innovation
content.summary: Advantech (TWSE: 2395), a global leader in Industrial AIoT, announced today the integration of Intel® Core™ Ultra Series 3 processors, built on Intel 18A, into its upcoming portfolio of industrial-grade motherboards and Edge AI computers. This strategic milestone strengthens the long-standing collaboration between Advantech and Intel, delivering breakthrough AI performance and enabling a new generation of intelligent, high-efficiency edge solutions.

headline: Acer Announces New Lineup of Premium Swift AI Copilot+ PCs Featuring Intel Core Ultra Series 3 Processors
summary: Acer today introduced its latest Swift AI laptop portfolio, a new generation of Copilot+ PCs on Windows 11 designed to deliver powerful on-device AI capabilities for creators, on-the-go-professionals, and tech-savvy users. The new lineup includes the Swift 16 AI, along with the Swift Edge AI, weighing as light as under 1 kg, and the versatile thin-and-light Swift Go AI in 14- and 16-inch variants.

content.title: Acer Announces New Lineup of Premium Swift AI Copilot+ PCs Featuring Intel Core Ultra Series 3 Processors

The new lineup includes the Swift 16 AI, along with the Swift Edge AI, weighing as light as under 1 kg, and the versatile thin-and-light Swift Go AI in 14- and 16-inch variants.

headline: TSMC Stock Rises, But Semiconductor Rally Fades
summary: TSMC stock edged higher Monday leading chip stocks higher as the trading session began.  Taiwan Semiconductor shares gained more than 2% in the morning, but the gains faded as the stock closed at 322.25, up nearly 1%.  Needham analyst Charles Shi cited "demand upside from Nvidia and Google" in projecting TSMC's AI revenue to exceed $200 billion by 2030.

content.title: TSMC Stock Rises, But Semiconductor Rally Fades
content.summary: TSMC stock edged higher Monday leading chip stocks higher as the trading session began.  Taiwan Semiconductor shares gained more than 2% in the morning, but the gains faded as the stock closed at 322.25, up nearly 1%.  Needham analyst Charles Shi cited "demand upside from Nvidia and Google" in projecting TSMC's AI revenue to exceed $200 billion by 2030.

headline: Intel launches next-gen PC chip at CES in Las Vegas
summary: Intel launched Panther Lake, its new AI chip for laptops, on Monday at the CES trade show in Las Vegas, as the company seeks to ​reassure investors about the first product made using its next-generation manufacturing process called 18A.  Jim Johnson, ‌senior vice president and general manager of Intel's PC group, offered technical details about the company's first line of Panther Lake chips known ‌as Intel Core Ultra Series 3.  The chips feature a new transistor design and a way to deliver power to the chip due to the company's 18A manufacturing process.

content.title: Intel launches next-gen PC chip at CES in Las Vegas
content.summary: Intel launched Panther Lake, its new AI chip for laptops, on Monday at the CES trade show in Las Vegas, as the company seeks to ​reassure investors about the first product made using its next-generation manufacturing process called 18A.  Jim Johnson, ‌senior vice president and general manager of Intel's PC group, offered technical details about the company's first line of Panther Lake chips known ‌as Intel Core Ultra Series 3.  The chips feature a new transistor design and a way to deliver power to the chip due to the company's 18A manufacturing process.
